intro: Cephalophilon malaicum, commonly known as the Malacca crownflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of its branches. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
